Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Game
extends Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
This Class represents the whole Game. It manages the players and their workers, the gods and the board used during a match.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      Returns:
      the singleton instance.

    • restoreGame

      public void restoreGame​(Board board, java.util.List<Player> players, java.util.List<God> gods, int chosenPlayersNumber)
      Restore an instance of the Game saved on a file.
      Parameters:
      board - Board of the saved Game.
      players - Player List of the saved Game.
      gods - God List of the saved Game.
      chosenPlayersNumber - Number of Players playing in the saved Game.

    • getPlayerByNickname

      public Player getPlayerByNickname​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Returns a player given his nickname. Only the first occurrence is returned because the player nickname is considered to be unique. If no player is found null is returned.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to be found.
      Returns:
      Returns the player given his nickname, null otherwise.

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player player)
      Adds a player to the game. Notifies all the views if the playersNumber is already set.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to add to the game.

    • removePlayerByNickname

      public boolean removePlayerByNickname​(java.lang.String nickname, boolean notifyEnabled)
      Removes a player from the game. Notifies all the views if the notifyEnabled argument is set to true.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to remove from the game.
      notifyEnabled - set to true to enable a lobby disconnection message, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the player is removed, false otherwise.

    • removeWorkers

      public void removeWorkers​(java.lang.String activePlayerNickname)
      Removes all the workers of the given player nickname from the board. A notification with the updated board is sent to all the views.
      Parameters:
      activePlayerNickname - the nickname of the player whose workers must be removed.

    • getNumCurrentPlayers

      public int getNumCurrentPlayers()
      Number of current players added in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of players.

    • setChosenMaxPlayers

      public boolean setChosenMaxPlayers​(int chosenMaxPlayers)
      Sets the max number of players chosen by the first player joining the game.
      Parameters:
      chosenMaxPlayers - the max players number. Value can be 0 < x < MAX_PLAYERS.
      Returns:
      true if the argument value is 0 < x < MAX_PLAYERS, false otherwise.

    • getChosenPlayersNumber

      public int getChosenPlayersNumber()
      Returns the number of players chosen by the first player.
      Returns:
      the number of players chosen by the first player.

    • getWorkerByPosition

      public Worker getWorkerByPosition​(Position position)
      Returns a worker given the position argument.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the worker.
      Returns:
      the worker found, null if not found.

    • isNicknameTaken

      public boolean isNicknameTaken​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Search a nickname in the current Game.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      true if the nickname is found, false otherwise.

    • resetInstance

      public static void resetInstance()
      Resets the game instance. After this operations, all the game data is lost.

    • getReduceGodList

      public java.util.List<ReducedGod> getReduceGodList()
      Returns a list of reduced gods.
      Returns:
      a list with all reduced gods.

    • getGodByName

      public God getGodByName​(java.lang.String godName)
      Return the god given his name.
      Parameters:
      godName - the name of the god.
      Returns:
      the corresponding God object, null if it is not found.

    • getPlayersNicknames

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPlayersNicknames()
      Returns a list of player nicknames that are already in-game.
      Returns:
      a list with all nicknames in the Game

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Returns the current board.
      Returns:
      the board of the game.

    • initWorkersOnBoard

      public void initWorkersOnBoard​(java.util.List<Worker> workers)
      Sets the workers on the board at the worker position. This method should be called only on game start. See Board.initWorkers(java.util.List<it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Worker>).
      Parameters:
      workers - a list of workers.

    • moveWorker

      public void moveWorker​(Worker worker, Position dest)
      Moves a worker to the given Position. Finally, a notification to the views is sent. See Board.moveWorker(it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Worker, it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position).
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker to be moved.
      dest - the destination of the move.

    • buildBlock

      public void buildBlock​(Worker worker, Position dest)
      Builds a single block over the Space at the given position. See Board.buildBlock(it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Worker, it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position).
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker who builds.
      dest - the space position to build onto.

    • getReducedSpaceBoard

      public ReducedSpace[][] getReducedSpaceBoard()
      Returns a matrix of ReducedSpace which is an immutable object. See Board.getReducedSpaceBoard().
      Returns:
      a board of reduced spaces

    • getFreePositions

      public java.util.List<Position> getFreePositions()
      Returns the free positions on the board. See Board.getFreePositions().
      Returns:
      the free positions on the board.

    • arePositionsFree

      public boolean arePositionsFree​(java.util.List<Position> positionList)
      Check if positionList refers only to free spaces. See Board.arePositionsFree(java.util.List<it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position>).
      Parameters:
      positionList - positionList from client.
      Returns:
      true if all the positions in the argument list are free, false otherwise.

    • getNextSpaceInLine

      public Space getNextSpaceInLine​(Position orig, Position dest)
      Return the next Space on the line passing between orig and dest. See Board.getNextSpaceInLine(it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position, it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position).
      Parameters:
      orig - the starting position.
      dest - the destination position.
      Returns:
      the next Space on the line passing between orig and dest, null if the next Space on the line is invalid.

    • getNeighbours

      public java.util.List<Position> getNeighbours​(Position position)
      Returns a list of positions that are adjacent to the position argument. See Board.getNeighbours(it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position).
      Parameters:
      position - The position to look for the neighbours.
      Returns:
      The list of spaces adjacent to this space.

    • getNeighbourWorkers

      public java.util.List<Position> getNeighbourWorkers​(Position position, boolean oppOnly)
      Returns a list of positions that are adjacent to the position argument and are occupied by a worker. See Board.getNeighbourWorkers(it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position, boolean).
      Parameters:
      position - The position to look for the neighbours.
      oppOnly - If set to true only opponent workers are checked.
      Returns:
      The list of spaces adjacent to this space.

    • getMoveTypeByLevel

      public MoveType getMoveTypeByLevel​(Position orig, Position dest)
      Returns the MoveType needed to perform the move from the first position argument to the second position argument. Comparison is done by checking the current levels of the spaces. Returns null if the arguments are not neighbours. See Board.getMoveTypeByLevel(it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position, it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Position).
      Parameters:
      orig - the starting position.
      dest - the destination position.
      Returns:
      the MoveType needed to perform the move from the first position argument to the second position argument. Returns null if the arguments are not neighbours or if the origin position is the same as the destination.

    • getSpaceLevel

      public int getSpaceLevel​(Position position)
      Returns the level of the given space.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the space to be checked.
      Returns:
      the level of the given space.

    • getEnemyWorkers

      public java.util.List<Worker> getEnemyWorkers​(Worker worker)
      Returns the enemy workers given a worker.
      Parameters:
      worker - the target worker.
      Returns:
      a List of Worker that are enemies of the argument.

    • getAllyWorkers

      public java.util.List<Worker> getAllyWorkers​(Worker worker)
      Returns the ally workers given a worker.
      Parameters:
      worker - the target worker.
      Returns:
      a List of Worker that are ally of the argument worker.

    • getOtherWorker

      public Worker getOtherWorker​(Worker worker)
      Returns the other player worker given a worker.
      Parameters:
      worker - a player worker.
      Returns:
      the other player worker, null if none is found.

    • getWorkersByTargetType

      public java.util.List<Worker> getWorkersByTargetType​(Worker worker, TargetType targetType)
      Returns a list of workers based on the target type parameter and the base worker.
      Parameters:
      worker - the base worker used for comparison.
      targetType - the target type.
      Returns:
      a list of workers.

    • getPlayers

      public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
      Returns a list of players.
      Returns:
      the players.

    • getGods

      public java.util.List<God> getGods()
      Returns a list of gods available in the game.
      Returns:
      a list of all the gods available in the game.
